gurmukhi: ੴ> ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ||
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਮੰਗਲਾਚਰਣ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਚਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚੁ ਖੰਡੁ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Sachaa Paatisaahu Saadhasangati Sachu Khandu Vasaaiaa.
translation: The true Guru is true emperor who has founded the abode of truth in the  form of the congregation of the saints.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਲੈ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikh Lai Gurasikh Hoi Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaiaa.
translation: The Sikhs living there being taught by the Guru, lose their ego and never make themselves noticed.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸਭੋ ਸਾਧਨਾ ਸਾਧਿ ਸਧਾੲਿ ਸਾਧੁ ਸਦਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gurasikh Sabho Saadhanaa Saadhi Sadhaai Saadhu Sadavaaiaa.
translation: The Sikhs  of the Guru get themselves called sadhus only after accomplishing all sorts  of discipline.

gurmukhi: ਚਹੁ ਵਰਣਾ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਦੇ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੁ ਰਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Chahu Varanaa Oupadays Day Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rahaaiaa.
translation: They preach to all the four varnas and themselves remain  indifferent in the midst of maya.

gurmukhi: ਸਚਹੁ ਓਰੈ ਸਭ ਕਿਹੁ ਸਚੁ ਨਾੳੁ ਗੁਰਮੰਤੁ ਦਿੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sachahu Aorai Sabhu Kihu Sachu Naau Guramantu Dirhaaiaa.
translation: They explain clearly that everything is  below truth i.e. the truth is highest and only this mantra should be recited  with deep integrity.

gurmukhi: ਹੁਕਮੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸਭ ਕੋ ਮੰਨੈ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਸੁ ਸਚਿ ਸਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Houkamai Andari Sabh Ko Mannai Houkamu Su Sachi Samaaiaa.
translation: Everything is subsumed in the divine order and  whosoever bows his head before His order, merges in the truth.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧||
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Alakhu Lakhaaiaa ?1?
translation: The  consciousness attuned to the Word makes man competent to behold the  invisible Lord.

gurmukhi: ੨ ਦੋ ਦੀ ਗਿਣਤੀ, ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਮਹਿਮਾਂ
translation: Twosome,the glory of Gurmukh  ,

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਸਕਤੀ ਨੋ ਸਾਧਿ ਕੈ ਚੰਦੁ ਸੂਰਜ ਦਿਹੁਂ ਰਾਤਿ ਸਧਾੲੇ
transliteration: Siv Sakatee No Saadhi Kai Chandu Sooraju Dihoun Raati Sadhaaay.
translation: Conquering Siva and S'akti (the rajas and tamas qualities), the gurmukhs have disciplined the moon-sun (ira, pingala) and also the time known by days and nights.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖ ਦੁਖ ਸਾਧੇ ਹਰਖ ਸੋਗ ਨਰਕ ਸੁਰਗ ਪੁੰਨ ਪਾਪ ਲੰਘਾੲੇ
transliteration: Soukh Doukh Saadhay Harakh Sog Narak Surag Pounn Paap Laghaaay.
translation: Subjugating pleasure and pain, joy and suffering, they  have gone beyond hell and heaven, sin and virtue.

gurmukhi: ਜਨਮ ਮਰਣ ਜੀਵਨੁ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਭਲਾ ਬੁਰਾ ਮਿਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਸਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਨਿਵਾੲੇ
transliteration: Janam Maran Jeevanu Moukati Bhalaa Buraa Mitr Satr Nivaaay.
translation: They have humbled life,  death, liberation in life, right and wrong, enemy and friend.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜ ਜੋਗ ਜਿਣਿ ਵਸਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਾਧਿ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਵਿਜੋਗੁ ਰਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Raaj Jog Jini Vasi Kari Saadhi Sanjogu Vijogu Rahaaay.
translation: Being victors  of raj and yoga (temporality and spirituality), they have disciplined alliance  as well as separation.

gurmukhi: ਵਸਗਤਿ ਕੀਤੀ ਨੀਂਦ ਭੂਖ ਅਾਸਾ ਮਨਸਾ ਜਿਣਿ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Vasagati Keetee Neend Bhookh Aasaa Manasaa Jinee Ghari Aaay.
translation: Conquering sleep, hunger, hope and desire, they  have made their abode in their own true nature.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸਤੁਤਿ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਸਾਧਿ ਕੈ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣ ਸਬਾੲੇ
transliteration: Ousatati Nidaa Saadhi Kai Hindoo Mousalamaan Sabaaay.
translation: Going beyond praise and  slander, they have become beloved of the Hindus as well as Muslims.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਸਦਾੲੇ ||੨||
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Sadaaay ?2?
translation: They  bow before all and consider themselves as dust.

gurmukhi: ੩ ਤਿੰਨ ਦੀ ਗਿਣਤੀ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Threesome-gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਮਹੇਸੁ ਤ੍ਰ੍ਰੈ ਲੋਕ ਵੇਦ ਗੁਣ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਲੰਘਾੲੇ
transliteration: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Trai Lok Vayd Goun Giaan Laghaaay.
translation: The gurmukhs have gone ahead of the three worlds, three gunas (rajas,  sattva and tamas) and Brahma Visnu Mahesa.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਤ ਭਵਿਖਹੁ ਵਰਤਮਾਨ ਅਾਦਿ ਮਧਿ ਜਿਣਿ ਅੰਤਿ ਸਿਧਾੲੇ
transliteration: Bhoot Bhavikhahu Varatamaanu Aadi Madhi Jini Anti Sidhaaay.
translation: They know the mystery of  the beginning, the middle, the end, of past, present and future.

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਬਚ ਕਰਮ ੲਿਕੱਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਕਰਿ ਜੰਮਣ ਮਰਣ ਜੀਵਣ ਜਿਣਿ ਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Man Bach Karam Ikatr Kari Janman Maran Jeevan Jini Aaay.
translation: They keep  together in one line their mind, speech and action and conquer birth, life  and death.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਧਿ ਬਿਅਾਧਿ ੳੁਪਾਧਿ ਸਾਧਿ ਸੁਰਗਮਿਰਤ ਪਾਤਾਲ ਨਿਵਾੲੇ
transliteration: Aadhi Biaadhi Oupaadhi Saadhi Surag Mirat Paataal Nivaaay.
translation: Subjugating all the maladies, they have humbled this world,  heaven and the nether world.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤਮ ਮਧਮ ਨੀਚ ਸਾਧਿ ਬਾਲਕ ਜੋਬਨ ਬਿਰਧਿ ਜਿਣਾੲੇ
transliteration: Outamu Madham Neech Saadhi Baalak Joban Biradhi Jinaaay.
translation: Winning the top, middle and the lowest  positions they have conquered the childhood, youth and the old age.

gurmukhi: ੲਿੜਾ ਪਿੰਗੁਲਾ ਸੁਖਮਨਾ ਤ੍ਰਿਕੁਟੀ ਲੰਘਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਬੇਣੀ ਨ੍ਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Irhaa Pingulaa Soukhamanaa Trikoutee Laghi Tribainee Nhaaay.
translation: Crossing  trikuti, the conjunction of three naris – ira, pingala, susumna in between the  eyebrows, they have bathed in the triveni, the pilgrimage centre at the  confluence of Ganges, Yamuna and Sarasvati.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ੲਿਕੁ ਮਨ ੲਿਕ ਧਿਅਾੲੇ ||੩||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Iku Mani Iku Dhiaaay ?3?
translation: With concentrated mind,  gurmukhs adore only one Lord.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਚੌਕੜੀ ਦਾ ਵਰਣਨ, ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Four some-gurmukh  ,

gurmukhi: ਅੰਡਜ ਜੇਰਜ ਸਾਧਿ ਕੈ ਸੇਤਜ ੳੁਤਭੁਜ ਖਾਣੀ ਬਾਣੀ
transliteration: Andaj Jayraj Saadhi Kai Saytaj Outabhuj Khaanee Baanee.
translation: The gurmukhs  subdue the four life-mines (egg, foetus, sweat, vegetation)  and the four speeches (para, posyanti, madhyama, vaikhari~.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰੇ ਕੁੰਡਾ ਚਾਰਿ ਜੁਗ ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਚਾਰਿ ਵੇਦ ਵਖਾਣੀ
transliteration: Chaaray Koundaan Chaari Joug Chaari Varani Chaari Vaydu Vakhaanee.
translation: Four are  directions, four the yugas (ages), four varnas and four are the Vedas.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਮ ਅਰਥੁ ਕਾਮੁ ਮੋਖੁ ਜਿਣਿ ਰਜ ਤਮ ਸਤ ਗੁਣ ਤੁਰੀਅਾ ਰਾਣੀ
transliteration: Dharamu Aradu Kaamu Mokhu Jini Raj Tam Sat Goun Tureeaa Raanee.
translation: Conquering dharma, artha, kama, moksa and crossing three stagges of rajas,  sattva and tamas they enter into the fourth stage turiya, the stage of supreme  bliss.

gurmukhi: ਸਨਕਾਦਿਕ ਅਾਸ੍ਰਮ ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ਚਾਰਿ ਵੀਰ ਵਸਗਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਣੀ
transliteration: Sanakaadik Aasram Ulaghi Chaari Veer Vasagati Kari Aanee.
translation: They control Sanak, Sanandan Sanatan, Sanatkumar, the four  ashramas and the four warriors (in the field of charity, dharma, compassion  and warfare).

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਪੜਿ ਜਿੳੁ ਚੳੁਸਾਰ ਮਾਰਿ ਜੋੜਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਨ ਕੋੲਿ ਰਞਞਞਞਾਣੀ
transliteration: Chaouparhi Jiu Chaousaar Maari Jorhaa Hoi N Koi Raanee.
translation: As in chaupar (a game like blackgamman played with an  oblong dice) one is victorious by winning all the four sides, and a twosome  is not killed,

gurmukhi: ਰੰਗ ਬਿਰੰਗ ਤੰਬੋਲ ਰਸ ਬਹੁ ਰੰਗੀ ੲਿਕੁ ਰੰਗੁ ਨੀਸਾਣੀ
transliteration: Rang Birang Tanbol Ras Bahu Rangee Iku Rangu Neesaanee.
translation: As in chaupar (a game like blackgamman played with an  oblong dice) one is victorious by winning all the four sides, and a twosome  is not killed,

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਨਿਰਬਾਣੀ ||੪||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Nirabaanee ?4?
translation: So the gurmukh also makes pair with the One Lord and becomes  undefeatable.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਪੰਚ ਹਰ ਸੰਖ੍ਰਯਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Fivesome-gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁਣੁ ਪਾਣੀ ਬੈਸੰਤਰੋ ਧਰਤਿ ਅਕਾਸੁ ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ਪੲਿਅਾਣਾ
transliteration: Paounu Paanee Baisantaro Dharati Akaasu Ulaghi Paiaanaa.
translation: Gurmukh goes beyond air, water, fire, earth and sky.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮ ਕਰੋਧੁ ਵਿਰੋਧੁ ਲੰਘਿ ਲੋਭੁ ਮੋਹੁ ਅਹੰਕਾਰ ਵਿਹਾਣਾ
transliteration: Kaamu Krodhu Virodhu Laghi Lobhu Mohu Ahankaaru Vihaanaa.
translation: Resisting lust and  anger he crosses the greed, infatuation and ego.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿ ਸੰਤੋਖ ਦੲਿਅਾ ਧਰਮੁ ਅਰਥੁ ਸੁ ਗ੍ਰੰਥ ਪੰਚ ਪਰਵਾਣਾ
transliteration: Sati Santokh Daiaa Dharamu Aradu Su Garandu Panch Paravaanaa.
translation: He espouses truth,  contentment, compassion, dharma and fortitude.

gurmukhi: ਖੇਚਰ ਭੂਚਰ ਚਾਚਰੀ ੳੁਨਮਨ ਲੰਘਿ ਅਗੋਚਰ ਬਾਣਾ
transliteration: Khaychar Bhoochar Chaacharee Ounaman Laghi Agochar Baanaa.
translation: Getting above of the  khechar bhuchar chachar, unman and agochar (all yogic postures) mudras  he concentrates upon the One Lord.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਚਾੲਿਣ ਪਰਮੇਸਰੋ ਪੰਚ ਸਬਦ ਘਨਘੋਰ ਨੀਸਾਣਾ
transliteration: Panchaain Paramaysaro Panch Sabad Ghanaghor Neesaanaa.
translation: He beholds God in five (select persons)  and the five sounds of five words become his special marks.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਚ ਭੂਅਾਤਮਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਸਾਧ ਸੁਹਾਣਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Panch Bhooaatamaa Saadhasangati Mili Saadh Suhaanaa.
translation: Antahkaran,  the basis of all five external elements is cultivated and cultured by gurmukh  in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਜ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਨ ਅਾਵਣ ਜਾਣਾ ||੫||
transliteration: Sahaj Samaadhi N Aavan Jaanaa ?5?
translation: This way immersing in undisturbed trance he  gets liberated from the cycle of transmigration.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਛੇ ਦੀ ਗਿਣਤੀ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Sixsome-gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਰੁਤੀ ਕਰਿ ਸਾਧਨਾਂ ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨ ਸਾਧੈ ਗੁਰਮਤੀ
transliteration: Chhia Routee Kari Saadhanaan Chhia Darasan Saadhai Guramatee.
translation: Attaining spiritual discipline through the six seasons, gurmukh assimilates  even the six philosophies.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਰਸ ਰਸਨਾ ਸਾਧਿ ਕੈ ਰਾਗ ਰਾਗਣੀ ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤੀ
transliteration: Chhia Ras Rasanaa Saadi Kai Raag Raaganee Bhaai Bhagatee.
translation: He conquers the six tastes (sour, sweet,  astringent, bitter, tart and saltish) of the tongue and alongwith six musical  measures and their consorts surrenders with full devotions.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਚਿਰਜੀਵੀ ਛਿਅ ਜਤੀ ਚੱਕ੍ਵਰਤਿ ਛਿਅ ਸਾਥਿ ਜੁਗਤੀ
transliteration: Chhia Chirajeevee Chhia Jatee Chakravarati Chhia Saadhi Jougatee.
translation: He understands  and accomplishes the ways of life of six immortal ones, six yatis (ascetics)  and six yogic chakras.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਛਿਅ ਕਰਮ ਜਿਣਿ ਛਿਅਾ ਗੁਰਾਂ ਗੁਰ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਨਿਰਤੀ
transliteration: Chhia Saasatr Chhia Karam Jini Chhia Guraan Gur Surati Niratee.
translation: Conquering the six codes of conduct and the six  philosophies, he cultivates friendship with the six gurus (teachers of these  philosophies).

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਵਰਤਾਰੇ ਸਾਧਿ ਕੈ ਛਿਅ ਛਕ ਛਤੀ ਪਵਣ ਪਰਤੀ
transliteration: Chhia Varataaray Saadhi Kai Chhia Chhak Chhatee Pavan Paratee.
translation: He turns his face from the five external organs plus one  internal organ, the mind, and their attendant thirty six kinds of hypocrisies.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤੀ ||੬||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabad Suratee ?6?
translation: Reaching the holy congregation the consciousness of a gurmukh gets  absorbed in the Word of Guru.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਸਪਤ ਸੰਖ੍ਰਯਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Sevensome-gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਸਤ ਸਮੁੰਦ ੳੁਲੰਘਿਅਾ ਦੀਪ ਸਤ ੲਿਕ ਦੀਪਕੁ ਬਲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sat Samound Ulaghiaa Deep Sat Iku Deepaku Baliaa.
translation: Getting above of the seven oceans and seven Continents, the gurmukh lights  the lamp of knowledge.

gurmukhi: ਸਤ ਸੂਤ ੲਿਕ ਸੂਤ ਕਰਿ ਸਤੇ ਪੁਰੀਅਾ ਲੰਘਿ ੳੁਛਲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sat Soot Ik Sooti Kari Satay Pureeaa Laghi Ouchhaliaa.
translation: He binds the seven threads (five organs, mind and  wisdom) of body into one thread (of high consciousness) and goes across  the seven (mythological) habitats (puris).

gurmukhi: ਸਤ ਸਤੀ ਜਿਣਿ ਸਪਤ ਰਿਖਿ ਸਤਿ ਸੁਰਾ ਜਿਣਿ ਅਟਲੁ ਨ ਟਲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sat Satee Jini Sapat Rikhi Sati Suraa Jini Atalu Naa Taliaa.
translation: Understanding the intrinsic  meaning of seven satis, seven rishis and seven musical notes, he remains  steadfast in his resolves.

gurmukhi: ਸਤੇ ਸੀਵਾਂ ਸਾਧਿ ਕੈ ਸਤੀਂ ਸੀਵੀਂ ਸੁਫਲਿਓ ਫਲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satay Seevaan Saadhi Kai Sateen Seeveen Suphaliao Phaliaa.
translation: Crossing the seven stages of knowledge, gurmukh  gets the fruit of the knowledge of Brahm, the basis of all the stages.

gurmukhi: ਸਤ ਅਾਕਾਸ ਪਤਾਲ ਸਤ ਵਸਿਗਤਿ ਕਰਿ ੳੁਪਰੇਰੈ ਚਲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sat Akaas Pataal Sat Vasigati Kari Ouparayrai Chaliaa.
translation: Controlling the seven nether worlds and seven skies he goes beyond them.

gurmukhi: ਸਤੇ ਧਾਰੀ ਲੰਘਿਕੈ ਭੈਰੳੁ ਖੇਤ੍ਰ੍ਰਪਾਲ ਦਲ ਮਲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satay Dhaaree Laghi Kai Bhairau Khaytrapaal Dal Maliaa.
translation: Getting across the seven streams, he decimates the armies of Bhairav and  other protectors of the worlds.

gurmukhi: ਸਤੇ ਰੋਹਣਿ ਸਤਿ ਵਾਰ ਸਤਿ ਸੁਹਾਗਣਿ ਸਾਧ ਨ ਢਲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satay Rohani Sati Vaar Sati Suhaagani Saadhi N Dphaliaa.
translation: The seven rohinis  seven days and the seven  married women and their ritualistic activities cannot upset him.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਖਲਿਅਾ ||੭||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Vichi Khaliaa ?7?
translation: Gurmukh  always remains stabilized in the true congregation.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਅਸ਼ਟ ਸੰਖ੍ਰਯਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Eightsome-gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਅਠੈ ਸਿਧੀ ਸਾਧਿ ਕੈ ਸਾਧਿਕ ਸਿਧ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਫਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Abhai Sidhee Saadhi Kai Saadhik Sidh Samaadhi Phalaaee.
translation: Accomplishing eight siddhis (powers) the gurmukh has attained the fruit of  adept trance (siddh samadhi).

gurmukhi: ਅਸਟ ਕੁਲੀ ਬਿਖੁ ਸਾਧਨਾ ਸਿਮਰਣਿ ਸੇਖ ਨ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Asat Kulee Bikhu Saadhanaa Simarani Saykh N Keemati Paaee.
translation: The practices by the eight ancestoral family  houses of Sesanag could not understand His mystery.

gurmukhi: ਮਣੁ ਹੁੲਿ ਅਠ ਪੈਸੇਰੀਅਾ ਪੰਜੂ ਅਠੇ ਚਾਲੀਹ ਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Manu Hoi Atd Paisayreeaa Panjoo Atday Chaaleeh Bhaaee.
translation: One maund (old Indian  weighing unit) consists of eight panseris (about five kilograms), and five  multiplied by eight is equal to forty.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਚਰਖਾ ਅਠ ਖੰਭੀਅਾ ੲਿਕਤੁ ਸੂਤਿ ਰਹੈ ਲਿਵਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jiu Charakhaa Atd Khanbheeaa Ikatu Sooti Rahai Liv Laaee.
translation: The spinning wheel having eight spokes  keeps its consciousness concentrated in a single thread.

gurmukhi: ਅੱਠ ਪਹਿਰ ਅਸਟਾਂਗ ਜੋਗੁ ਚਾਵਲ ਰਤੀ ਮਾਸਾ ਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Atd Pahir Asataangu Jogu Chaaval Ratee Maasaa Raaee.
translation: Eight watches, eight limbed yoga, chaval (rice), ratti, rais, masa (all old Indian measuring units of time and weight) have among themselves the relationship of eight i.e. eight  rais = one chaval, eight chavals = one ratti and  eight rattis = one masa.

gurmukhi: ਅਠ ਕਾਠਾ ਮਨੁ ਵਸ ਕਰਿ ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਧਾਤੁ ਕਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Atd Kaatdaa Manu Vas Kari Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaatu Karaaee.
translation: Controlling the mind comprising eight  inclinations, the gurmukh has made it homogenous as the eight metals after  mixing become one metal.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ||੮||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Vadee Vadiaaee ?8?
translation: Great is the glory of the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਨਵ ਸੰਖ੍ਰਯਾ-ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Ninesome-gurmukh -

gurmukhi: ਨਥਿ ਚਲਾੲੇ ਨਵੈ ਨਾਥਿ ਨਾਥਾ ਨਾਥ ਅਨਾਥ ਸਹਾੲੀ
transliteration: Nadi Chalaaay Navai Naadi Naadaa Naadu Anaad Sahaaee.
translation: Though, the gurmukh subdues the nine naths (ascetic yogis) yet he considers  himself as without any father i.e. most humble, and God as the father of the  fatherless ones.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਫੁਰਮਾਨ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਰਮ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਗੁਰਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Nau Nidhaan Phuramaan Vichi Param Nidhaan Giaan Gurabhaaee ?
translation: Nine treasures are in his command and the great ocean of  knowledge goes with him like his brother.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁ ਭਗਤੀ ਨੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਭਗਤਿ ਲਿਵਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Nau Bhagatee Nau Bhagati Kari Guramoukhi Praym Bhagati Liv Laaee.
translation: Neo devotees practise nine  types of ritualistic devotion but gurmukh remains immersed in the loving  devotion.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਸਾਧ ਗ੍ਹਿਸਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਪੂਰੇ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Naougrih Saadh Grihasat Vichi Pooray Satigur Dee Vadiaaee.
translation: With the blessings of the Guru and living the household life, he controls all the nine planets.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁਖੰਡ ਸਾਧ ਅਖੰਡ ਹੋੲਿ ਨੳੁ ਦੁਅਾਰਿ ਲੰਘਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Naoukhand Saadh Akhand Hoi Nau Duaari Laghi Nij Ghari Jaaee.
translation: Even conquering the nine divisions of earth,  he never gets broken up and, going above the illusions of nine doors of  body, hecomes to reside in his own self.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁ ਅੰਗ ਨੀਲ ਅਨੀਲ ਹੋੲਿ ਨੳੁ ਕੁਲ ਨਿਗ੍ਹ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Nau Ang Neel Aneel Hoi Nau Kul Nigrah Sahaji Samaaee.
translation: From nine numbers have been  counted infinite numbers, and controlling the nine pleasures (ras) in the  body, gurmukh stays in the equipoise.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲੀ ||੯||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaaee ?9?
translation: Only gurmukhs receive the  unattainable fruit of the supreme delight.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਦਸ ਸੰਖ੍ਰਯਾ-ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Tensome-gurmukh -

gurmukhi: ਸੰਨਿਅਾਸੀ ਦਸ ਨਾਵ ਧਰਿ ਸਚ ਨਾਵ ਵਿਣੁ ਨਾਵ ਗਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sanniaasee Das Naav Dhari Sach Naav Vinu Naav Ganaaiaa.
translation: Sannyasis, giving ten nomenclatures to their sects, but in fact being devoid  of the true Name have (egotistically) got their own names counted.

gurmukhi: ਦਸ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਅਕਾਰੁ ਕਰਿ ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰ ਨ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Das Avataar Akaaru Kari Aykankaaru N Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: Even the ten incarnations when they came in (human) form did not see that  invisible Oankar.

gurmukhi: ਤੀਰਥ ਪੁਰਬ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਵਿਚਿ ਦਸ ਪੁਰਬੀਂ ਗੁਰਪੁਰਬਿ ਨ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Teerad Purab Sanjog Vichi Das Purabeen Gur Purabi N Paaiaa.
translation: Celebrations of the ten auspicious days (no-moon, full  moon days etc.) at pilgrimage centres could not know the real importance  of Gurpurb, the anniversaries of the Gurus.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਮਨ ੲਿਕ ਨ ਚੇਤਿਓ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਣੁ ਦਹਦਿਸਿ ਧਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Ik Mani Ik N Chaytiao Saadhasangati Vinu Dahadisi Dhaaiaa.
translation: The individual did not ponder  upon the Lord with his concentrated mind and bereft of the holy congregation  he is running in all the ten directions.

gurmukhi: ਦਸ ਦਹਿਅਾਂ ਦਸ ਅਸ੍ਵਮੇਧ ਖਾੲਿ ਅਮੇਧ ਨਿਖੇਧੁ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Das Daheeaan Das Asamaydh Khaai Amaydh Nikhaydhu Karaaiaa.
translation: Ten days of Muslim Muharram and  ten horse sacrifices (asvamedh) are prohibited in Gurmat (Sikhism).

gurmukhi: ੲਿੰਦਰੀਅਾ ਦਸ ਵਸਿ ਕਰਿ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਵਰਜਿ ਰਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Indareeaan Das Vasi Kari Baahari Jaandaa Varaji Rahaaiaa.
translation: Gurmukh, controlling the ten organs stops the mind racing in ten directions.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਜਗੁ ਪੈਰੀ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Pairee Pai Jag Pairee Paaiaa ?10?
translation: He humbly bows at the Guru's feet and the whole world falls at his feet.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ੲੇਕਾਦਸ਼ ਸੰਖ੍ਰਯਾ-ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Elevensome-gurmukh -

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਮਨਿ ਹੋੲਿ ੲਿਕਾਦਸੀ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵਰਤੁ ਪਤਿਬ੍ਰਤਿ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Ik Mani Hoi Ikaadasee Guramoukhi Varatu Patibrati Bhaaiaa.
translation: Like a faithful wife, gurmukh likes the fast of ekadasi in the form of  concentration of mind (Hindus generally observe fast on the eleventh day  of lunar month).

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਰਹ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਸਮੁਦ੍ਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਲ ਦਾ ਪਾਰਾਵਾਰ ਨ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Giaarah Rudr Samudr Vichi Pal Daa Paaraavaaru N Paaiaa.
translation: Eleven Rudras (different forms of Siva) could not  understand the mystery of this world - ocean.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਰਹ ਕਸ ਗਿਅਾਰਹ ਕਸੇ ਕਸਿ ਕਸਵੱਟੀ ਕਸ ਕਸਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Giaarah Kas Giaarah Kasay Kasi Kasavatee Kas Kasaaiaa.
translation: The gurmukh has controlled  all the eleven (ten organs and the mind). Their eleven objects also he has  controlled and he has purified the mind-gold by rubbing it on the touchstone  of devotion.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਰਹ ਗੁਣ ਫੈਲਾੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਕਚ ਪਕਾੲੀ ਅਘੜ ਘੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Giaarah Goun Dhailaau Kari Kach Pakaaee Agharh Gharhaaiaa.
translation: Cultivating eleven virtues he has chiselled and stabilized the  tardy mind.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਰਹ ਦਾੳੁ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਕੁਦਾੳੁ ਰਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Giaarah Daau Charhhaau Kari Doojaa Bhaau Kudaau Rahaaiaa.
translation: Assuming eleven virtues (truth, contentment, compassion,  dharma, control, devotion etc.) he has erased duality and dubiousness.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਰਹ ਗੇੜਾ ਸਿਖੁ ਸੁਣਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੁ ਲੈ ਗੁਰਸਿਖੁ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Giaarah Gayrhaa Sikhu Souni Gur Sikhu Lai Gurasikhu Sadaaiaa.
translation: Listening to the mantra eleven times, the gurmukh adopting the teaching of  the Guru, is called Gursikh.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਬਦੁ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Guru Sabadu Vasaaiaa ?11?
translation: In the holy congregation only the Word-Guru  resides in one's heart.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਦ੍ਵਾਦਸ਼ ਸੰਖ੍ਰਯਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Twelvesome-gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਪੰਥ ਸਧਾੲਿਕੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਗਾਡੀ ਰਾਹ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baarah Pand Sadhaai Kai Guramoukhi Gaadee Raah Chalaaiaa.
translation: Winning over the twelve sects of yogis, the gurmukhs started a simple and  straight way (for liberation).

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜ ਬਾਰਹ ਮਾਹ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਸੀਅਰੁ ੲਿਕਤੁ ਮਾਹਿ ਫਿਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sooraj Baarah Maah Vichi Saseearu Ikatu Maahi Dhiraaiaa.
translation: It looks as if the sun circumambulates earth  in twelve months and the moon in one month but the fact is that the work  completed by the person having tamas and rajas qualities in twelve months  is done in one month by the person having sattva quality.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਸੋਲਹ ਮੇਲਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਸੀਅਰ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸੂਰ ਸਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baarah Solah Mayli Kari Saseear Andari Soor Samaaiaa.
translation: Combining twelve  (months) and sixteen (phases of moon) the sun merges into the moon i.e. rajas and tamas get absobed into the sattva.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਤਿਲਕ ਮਿਟਾੲਿਕੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਤਿਲਕੁ ਨੀਸਾਣੁ ਚੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baarah Tilak Mitaai Kai Guramoukhi Tilaku Neesaanu Charhaaiaa.
translation: Gurmukh repudiating the twelve  types of marks on forehead only keeps on his head the mark of the love of  Lord.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਰਾਸੀ ਸਾਧਿ ਕੈ ਸਚਿ ਰਾਸਿ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਲੁਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baarah Raasee Saadhi Kai Sachi Raasi Raharaasi Loubhaaiaa.
translation: Conquering the twelve zodiac signs, gurmukh remains absorbed in  the capital of truthful conduct.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਵੰਨੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਬਾਰਹ ਮਾਸੇ ਤੋਲਿ ਤੁਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baarah Vannee Hoi Kai Baarah Maasay Toli Tulaaiaa.
translation: Becoming pure gold of twelve masas (twenty  four carrots) they come true to their worth in the world market.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਸ ਪਾਰਸਿ ਪਰਸਿ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Paaras Paarasi Parasi Karaaiaa ?12?
translation: Touching  the philosopher's stone in the form of Guru, the gunnukhs also become  philosopher's stone.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ੍ਰਯੋਦਸ਼ ਸੰਖ੍ਰਯਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Thirteensome-gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਤੇਰਹ ਤਾਲ ਅੳੂਰਿਅਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਤਪ ਤਾਲ ਪੁਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Tayrah Taal Aooriaa Guramoukh Soukh Tapu Taal Puraaiaa.
translation: Thirteen beats of music are incomplete but gurmukh with his accomplishment  of the rythm (of household life) attains delight.

gurmukhi: ਤੇਰਹ ਰਤਨ ਅਕਾਰਥੇ ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਰਤਨੁ ਧਨੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Tayrah Ratan Akaaraday Gur Oupadaysu Ratanu Dhanu Paaiaa.
translation: Thirteen jewels are also  futile for the Gurmukh who gets the jewel of teaching of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਤੇਰਹ ਪਦ ਕਰਿ ਜਗ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਿਤਰ ਕਰਮ ਕਰਿ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Tayrah Pad Kari Jag Vichi Pitari Karam Kari Bharami Bhulaaiaa.
translation: The  ritualistic people have overawed the people in their thirteen types of rituals.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਲਖ ਜਗ ਨ ਪੁਜਨੀ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਚਰਣੋਦਕ ਪੀਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Jag N Pujanee Gurasikh Charanodak Peeaaiaa.
translation: Myriad burnt offerings (yajna) cannot be equated with nectar of the feet of  gurmukh.

gurmukhi: ਜਗ ਭੋਗ ਨੲੀਵੇਦ ਲਖ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮੁਖਿ ੲਿਕੁ ਦਾਣਾ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jag Bhog Naeevayd Lakh Guramoukhi Moukhi Iku Daanaa Paaiaa.
translation: Even one grain of gurmukh;s is equal to millions of yajnas,  offerings and edibles.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਭਾੲੀ ਸੰਤੁਸਟੁ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਿਰਮ ਚਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gurabhaaee Santousatu Kari Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piramu Chakhaaiaa.
translation: And by making their fellow disciples of the Guru  content, the Gurmukhs remain happy.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਛਲ ਛਲਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Bhagati Vachhalu Hoi Achhalu Chhalaaiaa ?13?
translation: God is undeceivable but He is dodged  by the devotees.
Fourteen,Fifteen and Sixteensome-gurmukh14 -15 -16  -

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਦਹ ਵਿਦਿਅਾ ਸਾਧਿਕੈ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ਅਕਥ ਕਹਾਣੀ
transliteration: Chaudah Vidiaa Saadhi Kai Guramati Abigati Akad Kahaanee.
translation: Accomplishing the fourteen skills, gurmukhs adopt the indescribable skill  of the wisdom of Guru (Gurmat).

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਦਹ ਭਵਣ ੳੁਲੰਘਿਕੈ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਵਾਸੁ ਨੇਹੁ ਨਿਰਬਾਣੀ
transliteration: Chaudah Bhavan Ulaghi Kai Nij Ghari Vaasu Nayhu Nirabaanee.
translation: Going across the fourteen worlds they  reside in their own self and remain immersed in the state of nirvana.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਦ੍ਹ ਥਿਤੀ ਪਖੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਕ੍ਰਿਸਨ ਸੁਕਲ ਦੁੲਿ ਪੱਖ ਨੀਸਾਣੀ
transliteration: Pandrah Ditee Pakhu Iku Krisan Soukal Dui Pakh Neesaanee.
translation: One  fortnight consists of fifteen days; one is the dark (krsna) fortnight and the  second is moonlit light (sukla)fortnight.

gurmukhi: ਸੋਲਹ ਸਾਰ ਸੰਘਾਰੁ ਕਰਿ ਜੋੜਾ ਜੁੜਿਅਾ ਨਿਰਭੳੁ ਜਾਣੀ
transliteration: Solah Saar Sanghaaru Kari Jorhaa Jurhiaa Nirabhau Jaanee.
translation: Like the game of dice, ousting the  sixteen counters and making the pair only, one attains fearlessness.

gurmukhi: ਸੋਲਹ ਕਲਾ ਸੰਪੂਰਣੋ ਸਸਿ ਘਰਿ ਸੂਰਜੁ ਵਿਰਤੀ ਹਾਣੀ
transliteration: Solah Kalaa Sanpoorano Sasi Ghari Sooraju Viratee Haanee.
translation: When  moon, the master of sixteen phases (full of sattvic quality) enters into the  sun (full of rajas and tamas), it gets faded.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਰਿ ਸੋਲਹ ਸੀਂਗਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਸੇਜ ਭਤਾਰ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸੁ ਮਾਣੀ
transliteration: Naari Solah Seengaar Kari Sayj Bhataar Piram Rasu Maanee.
translation: Woman also using sixteen  types of adornments goes to the bed of her husband and enjoys the extreme  delight.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਤੈ ਸਕਤਿ ਸਤਾਰਹ ਵਾਣੀ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Siv Tai Sakati Sataarah Vaanee ?14?
translation: The power (sakti) of Siva i.e. maya keeps with her seventeen  speeches or variations of its powers.
Eighteen to thirty-four18  34

gurmukhi: ਗੋਤ ਅਠਾਰਹ ਸੋਧਿਕੈ ਪੜੈ ਪੁਰਾਣ ਅਠਾਰਹ ਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Got Atdaarah Sodhi Kai Parhai Puraan Atdaarah Bhaaee.
translation: Thoroughly understanding the eighteen gotras, sub castes, the gurmukhs  go through the eighteen puranas.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਨੀ ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਲੰਘਿ ਬਾੲੀ ੳੁਮਰੇ ਸਾਧਿ ਨਿਵਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ounee Veeh Ikeeh Laghi Baaee Oumaray Saadhi Nivaaee.
translation: Jumping over nineteen, twenty and twenty-one.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਖ ਅਸੰਖ ਲੁਟਾੲਿਕੈ ਤੇੲੀ ਚੌਵੀ ਪੰਜੀਹ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sankh Asankh Loutaai Kai Tayee Chauvee Panjeeh Paaee.
translation: They make the number of twenty-three, twenty-four and twenty-five  meaningful.

gurmukhi: ਛਬੀ ਜੋੜਿ ਸਤਾੲੀਹਾ ਅਾੲਿ ਅਠਾੲੀਹ ਮੇਲ ਮਿਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Chhabee Jorhi Sataaeehaa Aai Atdaaeeh Mayli Milaaee.
translation: In the name of twenty-six, twenty-seven, twenty-eight they  meet the Lord.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ੳੁਣਤੀਹ ਤੀਹ ਸਾਧਿ ਲੰਘਿ ੲਿਕਤੀਹ ਵਜੀ ਵਧਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ulaghi Ounateeh Teeh Saadhi Laghi Ikateeh Vajee Vadhaaee.
translation: Crossing twenty-nine, thirty and reaching thirty-one, in  their heart they feel blest and delighted.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧ ਸੁਲਖਣ ਬਤੀਹੇ ਤੇਤੀਹ ਧ੍ਰੂ ਚੳੁਫੇਰਿ ਫਿਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Saadh Sulakhan Bateehay Tayteeh Dhr Chaudhayri Dhiraaee.
translation: Accomplishing the thirty-two saintly  characteristics, like Dhru they make thirty-three crore gods and goddesses shake and revolve around (them).

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਤੀਹ ਲੇਖ ਅਲੇਖ ਲਖਾੲੀ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Chaouteeh Laykh Alaykh Lakhaaee ?15?
translation: Touching thirty-four they realize the  Invisible Lord i.e. the gurmukhs going above all the numbers get exhilerated in the love of Lord who is beyond all the counts.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ੲੀਸ਼੍ਵਰੋਪਮਾ
translation: Praises of the lord

gurmukhi: ਵੇਦ ਕਤੇਬਹੁ ਬਾਹਰਾ ਲੇਖ ਅਲੇਖ ਨ ਲਖਿਅਾ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Vayd Kataybahu Baaharaa Laykh Alaykh N Lakhiaa Jaaee.
translation: God is beyond Vedas and katebas (holy books of Semitic religions) and He  cannot be visualized.

gurmukhi: ਰੂਪ ਅਨੂਪੁ ਅਚਰਜੁ ਹੈ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਅਗੋਚਰ ਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Roopu Anoopu Acharaju Hai Darasanu Drisati Agochar Bhaaee.
translation: His form is grand and awe-inspiring. He is beyond  the reach of body organs.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੁ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਤੋਲਨ ਤੁਲਾਧਾਰ ਨ ਸਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Iku Kavaau Pasaau Kari Tolu N Tulaadhaar N Samaaee.
translation: He created this cosmos by His one big bang  which cannot be weighed on any scale.

gurmukhi: ਕਥਨੀ ਬਦਨੀ ਬਾਹਰਾ ਥਕੈ ਸਬਦੁ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kadanee Badanee Baaharaa Dakai Sabadu Surati Liv Laaee.
translation: He is indescribable and many a  man in order to reach Him has got tired by putting their consciousness into  the Word.

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਬਚ ਕਰਮ ਅਗੋਚਰਾ ਮਤਿ ਬੁਧਿ ਸਾਧਿ ਸੋਝੀ ਥਕਿ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Man Bach Karam Agocharaa Mati Budhi Saadhi Sojhee Daki Paaee.
translation: Being beyond the ken of mind, speech, and action, the wisdom,  intellect and all practices have also left hope of catching hold of Him.

gurmukhi: ਅਛਲ ਅਛੇਦ ਅਭੇਦ ਹੈ ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲੁ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਛਾੲੀ
transliteration: Achhal Achhayd Abhayd Hai Bhagati Vachhalu Saadhasangati Chhaaee.
translation: Undeceivable, beyond time and non dual, the Lord is kind to devotees  and pervades through the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਵਡਾ ਅਾਪ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Vadaa Aapi Vadee Vadiaaee ?16?
translation: He is great and His grandeur  is also great

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ
translation: Gurmukh and fruits of delight

gurmukhi: ਵਣ ਵਣ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਣਾਸਪਤਿ ਰਹੈ ੳੁਜਾੜਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਅਵਸਾਰੀ
transliteration: Van Van Vichi Vanaasapati Rahai Ujaarhi Andari Avasaaree.
translation: The vegetation in the desolate places in the forest remains unknown.

gurmukhi: ਚੁਣਿ ਚੁਣਿ ਅਾਂਜਨਿ ਬੂਟੀਅਾ ਪਤਿਸਾਹੀ ਬਾਗ ਲਾੲਿ ਸਵਾਰੀ
transliteration: Chouni Chouni Aanjani Booteeaa Patisaahee Baagu Laai Savaaree.
translation: The  gardeners choose and pick up some plants and plant them in the garden of  the kings.

gurmukhi: ਸਿੰਜਿ ਸਿੰਜਿ ਬਿਰਖ ਵਡੀਰੀਅਨਿ ਸਾਰਿ ਸਮ੍ਹਾਲਿ ਕਰਨ ਵੀਚਾਰੀ
transliteration: Sinji Sinji Birakh Vadeereeani Saari Samhaali Karan Veechaaree.
translation: They are grown by irrigation, and the thoughtful persons take  care of them.

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਸਫਲ ਰੁਤਿ ਅਾੲੀਅੈ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਫਲ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਰਸ ਭਾਰੀ
transliteration: Honi Saphal Routi Aaeeai Anmrit Phalu Anmrit Rasu Bhaaree.
translation: In the season they fructify and offer juicy fruits.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਰਖਹੁ ਸਾੳੁ ਨ ਅਾਵੲੀ ਫਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਾੳੁ ਸੁਗੰਧਿ ਸੰਜਾਰੀ
transliteration: Birakhahu Saau N Aavaee Phal Vichi Saau Sougandhi Sanjaaree.
translation: There is no  taste in the tree but in fruit resides taste as well as flavour.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਜਗਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Pooran Braham Jagatr Vichi Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Nirankaaree.
translation: In the world,  the perfect Brahm resides in holy congregation of the gurmukhs.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਅਪਰ ਅਪਾਰੀ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Apar Apaaree ?17?
translation: In fact,  the gurmukhs themselves are the infinite pleasure-giving fruit in the world.

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਅੰਬਰ ਵਰਣਨ
translation: The sky

gurmukhi: ਅੰਬਰ ਨਦਰੀ ਅਾਂਵਦਾ ਕੇਵਡੁ ਵਡਾ ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Anbaru Nadaree Aanvadaa Kayvadu Vadaa Koi N Jaanai.
translation: The sky is seen but none knows its extent.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਚਾ ਕੇਵਡੁ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਸੁੰਨ ਸਰੂਪ ਨ ਅਾਖਿ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Ouchaa Kayvadu Aakheeai Sounn Saroop N Aakhi Vakhaanai.
translation: How much high it is in the form  of vaccum is not known to anybody.

gurmukhi: ਲੈਨਿ ੳੁਡਾਰੀ ਪੰਖਣੂ ਅਨਲ ਮਨਲ ੳੁਡਿ ਖਬਰਿ ਨ ਅਾਣੈ
transliteration: Laini Udaaree Pankhanoo Anal Manal Udi Khabari N Aanai.
translation: Birds fly in it and even the anal bird  which always remains flying does not know the mystery of sky.

gurmukhi: ਓੜਕੁ ਮੂਲਿ ਨ ਲਭੲੀ ਸਭੇ ਹੋੲਿ ਫਿਰਨਿ ਹੈਰਾਣੈ
transliteration: Aorhiku Mooli N Labhaee Sabhay Hoi Dhirani Hairaanai.
translation: Mystery  of its origin is not known to any body and all are wonder-struck.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਅਗਾਸ ਨ ਅਪੜਨਿ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਕਾਦਰ ਨੋ ਕੁਰਬਾਣੈ
transliteration: Lakh Agaas N Aparhani Kudarati Kaadaru No Kurabaanai.
translation: I am  sacrifice unto His Nature; even millions of skies cannot express His  grandeur.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਾਸਾ ਨਿਰਬਾਣੈ
transliteration: Paarabraham Satigur Purakhu Saadhasangati Vaasaa Nirabaanai.
translation: That true Lord resides in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਦਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Muradaa Hoi Mureedu Siaanai ?18?
translation: Only a devotee  who becomes dead from the point of view of ego, can identify him.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਗੁਰ ਮਹਿਮਾ
translation: Praises of the Guru

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਘਟਿ ਘਟਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸੂਰਜ ਸੁਝੈ
transliteration: Gur Moorati Pooran Brahamu Ghati Ghati Andari Sooraju Sujhai.
translation: Guru is the replica of the perfect Brahm, who like the sun is illuminating all  hearts.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜ ਕਵਲੁ ਪਰੀਤ ਹੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਬੁਝੈ
transliteration: Sooraj Kavalu Pareeti Hai Guramoukhi Praym Bhagati Kari Bujhai.
translation: As the lotus loves the sun so is the gurmukh who through loving  devotion knows the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਹੈ ਨਿਝਰ ਧਾਰ ਵਰ੍ਹੈ ਗੁਣ ਗੁਝੈ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Gur Sabadu Hai Nijhar Dhaar Varhai Goun Gujhai.
translation: Word of the Guru is the perfect Brahm who as a  one current of all the qualities flows eternally through one and all.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਰਖਿ ਬਿਰਖੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਫਲੁ ਫਲ ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸ ਨਿਵਾਸ ਨ ਖੁਝੈ
transliteration: Kirakhi Birakhu Hoi Saphalu Phali Channani Vaasu Nivaasu N Khujhai.
translation: Because  of that current, plants and trees grow and give flowers and fruits, and the  sandal also becomes fragrant.

gurmukhi: ਅਫਲ ਸਫਲ ਸਮਦਰਸ ਹੋੲਿ ਮੋਹੁ ਨ ਧੋਹ ਨ ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਲੁਝੈ
transliteration: Aphal Saphal Samadaras Hoi Mohu N Dhohu N Doubidhaa Lujhai.
translation: Whether some are fruitless or full of fruit, all become equally unbiased. Infatuation and dubiety do not put them to  trouble.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸੁ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਭੁਗਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਦੁਝੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Jeevan Moukati Bhagati Kari Dujhai.
translation: Liberation in life and supreme delight, gurmukh gets through  devotion.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮੁਝੈ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Mili Sahaji Samujhai ?19?
translation: In the holy congregation the state of equipoise is actually identified  and known.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ
translation: Guru-Word

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਗੁਰੂ ਗੁਰੁ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਧੁਨਿ ਚੇਲਾ
transliteration: Sabadu Guroo Guru Jaaneeai Guramoukhi Hoi Surati Dhouni Chaylaa.
translation: One should accept the word of the Guru as the Guru, and by becoming gurmukh  one makes his consciousness the disciple of the Word.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚਖੰਡ ਵਿਚਿ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਭਗਤਿ ਪਰਚੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਮੇਲਾ
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Sachakhand Vichi Praym Bhagati Parachai Hoi Maylaa.
translation: When one becomes  attached to the abode of truth in the form of holy congregation, he through  loving devotion meets the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਸਿਮਰਣ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਕੂੰਜ ਕੁਰਮ ਹੰਸ ਵੰਸੁ ਨਵੇਲਾ
transliteration: Giaanu Dhiaanu Simaranu Jougati Koonj Karam Hans Vans Navaylaa.
translation: In the art of knowledge, meditation and  rememberance, the Siberian crane, tortoise and swan respectively are adept  ones (in gurmukh all these three qualities are found).

gurmukhi: ਬਿਰਖਹੁਂ ਫਲ ਫਲ ਤੇ ਬਿਰਖੁ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸਿਖ ਗੁਰ ਮੰਤ ਸੁਹੇਲਾ
transliteration: Birakhahoun Phal Phal Tay Birakhu Gurasikh Sikh Gur Mantu Suhaylaa.
translation: As from tree the fruit  and from fruit (seed) again the tree is grown i.e. (tree and fruit are the same),  so is the simple philosophy that the Guru and the Sikh are the same.

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹਾਂ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਵਰਤਮਾਨ ਹੋੲਿ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਅਗੋਚਰੁ ਖੇਲਾ
transliteration: Veehaa Andari Varatamaan Hoi Ikeeh Agocharu Khaylaa.
translation: Word  of the Guru is present in the world but beyond this is the ekankar (ikis)  occupied in His invisible game (of creation and destruction).

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਅਾਦੇਸ ਵਹੇਲਾ
transliteration: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Kari Aadi Purakh Aadays Vahaylaa.
translation: Bowing before  that primeval Lord that power of the Word in His hukam merges into Him.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਫਤਿ ਸਲਾਹਣੁ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਵੇਲਾ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Sidhati Salaahanu Anmritu Vaylaa ?20?7?
translation: Ambrosial hours are the correct time for His praise.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਅਾਪਾ ਅਾਪ ਪ੍ਰਗਾਸ ਹੁੲਿ
transliteration: Pooran Braham Bibayka , Aapaa Aap Pragaas Hui ?
translation: Being supreme conscious and knowledgeable; it seems God Himself has descended as light divine in the form of Guru Hargobind.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮ ਦੋੲਿ ਪ੍ਰਭ ੲੇਕ ਗੁਰ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਬਖਾਨੀਅੈ ||੧||੭||
transliteration: Naam Doi Prabh Ayka , Gur Gobind Bakhaaneeai ?1?7?
translation: One may hold them (Guru Hargobind) and Gobind different due to their names, but in reality, God Himself has appeared in the form of Hargobind.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪਾ ਅਾਪ ਪ੍ਰਗਾਸ ਹੋੲਿ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਬਿਬੇਕ
transliteration: Aapaa Aap Pragaas Hoi , Pooran Braham Bibayk ?
translation: : Guru Hargobind the enlightened is manifest of Lord. He is granter of spiritual knowledge.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਬਖਾਨੀਅੈ ਨਾਮ ਦੋੲਿ ਪ੍ਰਭ ੲੇਕ ||੨||੭||
transliteration: Gur Gobind Bakhaaneeai , Naam Doi Prabh Ayk ?2?7?
translation: Guru and Gobind are just two separate names, but in reality it is Lord Himself who is manifest.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮ ਦੋੲਿ ਪ੍ਰਭ ੲੇਕ ਟੇਕ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਠਹਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Naam Doi Prabh Ayka , Tayk Gurmukhi Tthaharaaee ?
translation: Guru and Gobind though are two different names, in reality He himself is refulgent

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਭੲੇ ਗੁਰ ਨਾਮ ਦੁਤੀਅਾ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਬਡਾੲੀ
transliteration: Aadi Bhaay Gur Naama , Douteeaa Gobind Badaaee ?
translation: Sikhs ever in attendance of Guru has this strong belief that, first He was called Guru Arjan and then he gave this honour of Guruship to Hargobind.

gurmukhi: ਹਰਿ ਗੁਰ ਹਰਿਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਰਚਨ ਰਚਿ ਥਾਪਿ ਓਥਾਪਨ
transliteration: Hari Gur Harigobinda , Rachan Rachi Daapi Aodaapan ?
translation: God Lord is Guru Arjan Himself and then He Himself became Hargobind.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਪ੍ਰਗਟ ਹੁੲਿ ਅਾਪਾ ਅਾਪਨ ||੩||੭||
transliteration: Pooran Braham Bibayka , Pragat Hui Aapaa Aapan ?3?7?
translation: The Omnipotent Lord who created the cosmos, established it and has singular authority of destroying it; it seems He Himself has taken the form of Hargobind to reveal all knowledge about Himself. (7)
